post_text:
September is National Suicide Prevention Awareness Month. When schools and families work together, we can have a great impact on suicide prevention. The warning signs may be there, but we must be aware in order to take action. There are many suicide prevention resources for parents, teachers, and students on the Virginia Department of Education website. Take a look--you could help save a life!

http://www.doe.virginia.gov/support/prevention/suicide/index.shtml

post_text:
ATTENTION CENTRAL HIGH SCHOOL JUNIORS AND SENIORS. Herff Jones will be at Central High School on Thursday, September 10th from 3:30 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. to take junior class ring orders and senior orders for cap and gown, graduation announcements, letterman jackets, and other senior class items. The representatives will be set up outside of the main entrance and will be following all proper safety protocols. Masks will be worn and social distancing observed for everyone's protection.

For senior orders in excess of $80.00, a minimum deposit of $80.00 is required to place an order. A deposit of $80.00 is also required for Ultrium class ring orders. Gold or silver rings require a deposit of $150.00. Checks, cash, debit and credit cards and money orders are accepted for deposits. Thank you!

September is Attendance Awareness Month. Attendance matters, even virtually! Virtual attendance is based on logging in to Canvas to participate and submission of assignments for that week by 10:00 p.m. on Sunday night.

This year’s theme is Present, Engaged and Supported! To kick off this year's campaign, tag us in a photo of your students learning this week with the hashtags #imherelcps #lcpsvirtual

post_text:
LCPS FAMILIES--A couple of other locations for wifi access are now available!!

The Town of Kenbridge is excited to have their public wifi up and running. Click on Kenbridge Public Wifi. You can reach it from 5th Ave, the town offices parking lot, the park, the gym parking lot (as long as you don't park in close to the gym on Farmers Market side) and the Farmers Market.

Also, the Rosewood Cafe at Lunenburg Courthouse, has offered their personal wifi connection for school children during opening hours free of charge, if you are having difficulty with wifi. Space is limited and children must be accompanied by an adult. YOU MUST CALL TO RESERVE A TIME 434-696-1790!

shared_text:
Central High School
August 26 at 10:13 AM ·

Chrome/Chromebook Updates:

If you are having trouble with pages and/or videos loading, you may need to run an update on Chrome or the Chromebook itself.

To check for Chrome updates, click on the three dots at the top right. Click on Help and then About Google Chrome. Updates will then run automatically. After the update is done, restart your computer.

To update the Chromebook operating system, click on the time in the bottom right corner. Select settings. At the bottom left, select About Chrome OS. Select Check for Updates. If an update is needed, the update will start automatically. When the update is done, restart your computer.
text:
Central High School
August 26 at 10:13 AM ·

Chrome/Chromebook Updates:

If you are having trouble with pages and/or videos loading, you may need to run an update on Chrome or the Chromebook itself.

To check for Chrome updates, click on the three dots at the top right. Click on Help and then About Google Chrome. Updates will then run automatically. After the update is done, restart your computer.

To update the Chromebook operating system, click on the time in the bottom right corner. Select settings. At the bottom left, select About Chrome OS. Select Check for Updates. If an update is needed, the update will start automatically. When the update is done, restart your computer.

post_text: FREE MEALS ARE AVAILABLE MONDAY - FRIDAY EACH WEEK! Please call the LCPS Transportation Department at 676-2467 if you have questions about delivery. We recommend that you be at the bus stop at 3 p.m. As this first week goes on, it will become clearer exactly what time the bus will be at your bus stop. Pick up will be at Central High School and Kenbridge Elementary School from 3-6 p.m. Please let your school know if your child has food allergies! A doctor's note must be provided. More information in English and Spanish can be found on the link here. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LcFsSwOoFLfyxmwB8xw4RF_GDmraClRBmOreUR3sH8g/edit?usp=sharing

post_text: LCPS PARENTS AND STUDENTS: Just to clarify, the Canvas Student App is to be downloaded on your smart phone if you wish to use it. On your Chromebook, you will access Canvas through your internet browser. Thank you!

post_text: ATTENTION LCPS FAMILIES--MEAL INFORMATION IS NOW AVAILABLE! Starting Monday, August 24, breakfast and lunch will be provided Monday - Friday each week. ONLY LCPS students will receive meals. Meals will need to be heated. Meals will be delivered by bus if your student has a bus route. Buses will leave the schools at 3:00 p.m. Bear with us the first week of delivery--we could be a little later or a little earlier. Elementary and secondary routes will be combined. It could be a bus with a different number delivering your meals. Meals will also be available for pick up if your child does not ride a bus. Those meals can be picked up at Central High School and Kenbridge Elementary School from 3 - 6 p.m.

post_text: KES FAMILIES - KES Device Pick Up will be from 9 a.m. - 2 p.m. and again form 4-7 p.m. TODAY, Thursday, August 20, 2020. If we do not have all registration paperwork for your Pre K or Kindergarten child, you will NOT be issued a device nor will your child be assigned to a home room. There will be help available if you need to submit any paperwork for registration. Thank you for being patient as we all embark on this distance learning journey together!

ATTENTION VICTORIA ELEMENTARY AND KENBRIDGE ELEMENTARY FAMILIES:
Tablets and Chromebooks will be deployed to all elementary school students next week. Victoria Elementary Students will pick up tablets and Chromebooks on Tuesday, August 18 from 10:00 a.m. - 2 p.m. and again from 4 - 7 p.m. Kenbridge Elementary Students will pick tablets and Chromebooks up on Thursday, August 20 from 10:00 a.m. - 2 p.m. and again from 4 - 7 p.m. Virtual Open Houses at each school will be sent out as a link on the day that devices are deployed. Check Facebook and the website for those Virtual Open House links.

post_text: The Governor’s School of Southside Virginia held a very different orientation for our LCPS students today. GSSV will be all virtual for the first semester of 2020, but LCPS students were able to be on campus today for their orientation. COVID 19 health guidelines were being followed with everyone in face masks and social distancing being honored! Here’s to a healthy and safe beginning to the 2020-2021 school year!

Thank you to all the parents and students who came out, and thank you to the teachers for working these events on two very hot days!!

post_text: CHS Seniors, Class of 2021—Be sure to check your email for important information regarding senior portraits on Friday, August 7. There is an important change in pictures this year due to COVID-19. Drapes and tuxes WILL NOT be provided this year. We are asking ladies to wear a nice dress and gentlemen wear a dress shirt and a tie. If you do not have a tie, one can be provided. If there are any questions, please email mary.myers@k12lcps.org.

shared_text:
The Governor's School of Southside Virginia
July 28 at 2:37 PM ·

A packet of information was placed in the mail today to all students. This packet includes a detailed letter about GSSV's reopening, a calendar for days students will be on campus by county for orientation and labs, the student handbook, and forms that need to be completed and returned during orientation. Please keep a check on your mailbox and if you don't receive it in a week, contact us.

We are looking forward to starting the 2020-2012 school year in a few short weeks.

shared_text:
The Governor's School of Southside Virginia
July 7 at 12:19 PM ·

OPENING UPDATE:

GSSV has decided that the safest way to open the 2020-2021 school year is all virtual learning except for some science labs. We will be operating with a synchronous model meaning that students will be expected to join their Zoom class sessions every day. We are working with the local school divisions for a plan for those students who do not have strong Internet that allows Zoom streaming.

This letter is being mailed home to students today, along with the 2020-2021 GSSV calendar, that provides more details. More information will be forthcoming in the next few weeks as logistics are worked out including Orientation Day and lab days.

Thank you for your understanding and for your continued support of GSSV. Please don't hesitate to contact the director (wesley.swain@southside.edu) if you have any questions.

post_text: At the June 30th Lunenburg County School Board Meeting, Charles Berkley was presented with the Superintendent’s Scholarship for being named the Region 8 Superintendent of the Year. The Scholarship Award was presented by Kenny Word of RRMM Architects. Mr. Berkley will choose a senior next year who will receive this $500 scholarship award. Congratulations to Mr. Berkley, and we look forward to seeing who will receive this scholarship award next year!
text: At the June 30th Lunenburg County School Board Meeting, Charles Berkley was presented with the Superintendent’s Scholarship for being named the Region 8 Superintendent of the Year. The Scholarship Award was presented by Kenny Word of RRMM Architects. Mr. Berkley will choose a senior next year who will receive this $500 scholarship award. Congratulations to Mr. Berkley, and we look forward to seeing who will receive this scholarship award next year!

post_text:
ATTENTION LCPS PARENTS—If you have a Pre K student, Kindergarten student, or a child enrolling for the first time in our school system, they are required to have a current physical (within the last 12 months). The physical needs to be completed and submitted to the school before students enter schools in August. As a part of this process, immunizations need to be complete as well.
LMS PARENTS WITH A RISING 7TH GRADER—Your students will need to have the TDAP immunization before August as well, and submit proof of that to the middle school. These are state requirements—so plan now to be ready for August! Make an appointment with your health care provider now!
Call your child’s school if you have questions about any of this information.
Here is a link to the Commonwealth of Virginia School Entrance Health Form.
http://www.doe.virginia.gov/support/health_medical/school_entrance_form/school_entrance_form.pdf

Central Chargers Baseball
June 9 at 1:55 PM ·

We would like to offer our thoughts and prayers to the family and friends of Brandon Givens. Coach Givens was a LMS Baseball coach, LMS Basketball coach and teacher who also helped out youth leagues in the county. Today was a wonderful tribute at LMS where friends, family, and co-workers all came together to celebrate him with words, songs and a balloon release. One of the topics during the memorial was to "finish strong." I know Coach Givens would love those sentiments and those words to his students and athletes!!!! Irene Michelle Givens

shared_text:
Central High School
May 28 at 2:39 PM ·

Central Yearbooks Heads Up!
Just a heads up that with schools shutting down and many of the spring events being canceled, we have been getting great pictures from our students at home and will have lots of those in the yearbook. If anyone has any last-minute pictures they want to send, get them to us by Saturday.
In addition to that, the yearbook plant shut down temporarily and pushed back deadlines. We talked with them and decided that we wanted to get a complete year with every event possible in there so we will send in our finished book on June 1 as soon as graduation is done this weekend. This allows us to get these last few events in the book as well and tell the complete story of the year. The yearbooks will be back to us near the end of June and we will contact everyone, send out announcements, etc when they arrive. Here are just a few pictures from the Sword and Shield from last night with these and many more in the yearbook.
text:

May 28 at 2:39 PM ·

Central Yearbooks Heads Up!
Just a heads up that with schools shutting down and many of the spring events being canceled, we have been getting great pictures from our students at home and will have lots of those in the yearbook. If anyone has any last-minute pictures they want to send, get them to us by Saturday.
In addition to that, the yearbook plant shut down temporarily and pushed back deadlines. We talked with them and decided that we wanted to get a complete year with every event possible in there so we will send in our finished book on June 1 as soon as graduation is done this weekend. This allows us to get these last few events in the book as well and tell the complete story of the year. The yearbooks will be back to us near the end of June and we will contact everyone, send out announcements, etc when they arrive. Here are just a few pictures from the Sword and Shield from last night with these and many more in the yearbook.

TODAY, WEDNESDAY, MAY 27 IS OUR SENIOR CURBSIDE CELEBRATION AT 7 PM--Drive through the CHS parking lot and celebrate our seniors. Each senior will be recognized throughout the parking lot. You are encouraged to decorate your cars and invite family and friends to drive through. Please DO NOT get out of your cars. It would be great if community members could line the streets of Kenbridge and Victoria waving seniors on to this celebration. Then feel free to also drive through the parking lot. Businesses please decorate your windows this week to celebrate the Class of 2020.

***Ms. Watson will have shirts at this celebration for those who ordered one. There are a few extras on a first come first serve basis.

shared_text:
Piedmont Habitat for Humanity
May 6 at 6:31 PM ·

It's time for the world premiere of Welcome Home Doreen! Grab your popcorn, sit back, and enjoy. Since we were unable to gather as a community to celebrate Doreen's Home Dedication, due to the Covid-19 response, we wanted to put together a special video.
Doreen worked so hard to realize her dream, including countless hours helping build multiple Habitat home. Now she will enjoy the fruits of her labor as she moves in to her new energy-efficient home with an affordable mortgage...and yes Habitat homeowners pay a mortgage :)
If you would like to continue to support moments of joy such as this, please consider making a donation of any size so we can continue to help build brighter futures with our neighbors. You can donate safely and quickly on our website here- https://piedmonthabitat.org/make-an-impact/donate.html
Thank you and once again...Welcome Home Doreen!

Doreen worked so hard to realize her dream, including countless hours helping build multiple Habitat home. Now she will enjoy the fruits of her labor as she moves in to her new energy-efficient home with an affordable mortgage...and yes Habitat homeowners pay a mortgage :)

Thank you and once again...Welcome Home Doreen!

shared_text:
Kenbridge Elementary School
May 20 at 4:30 PM ·

Attention parents of 5th graders:

We will be hosting an informal “drive-thru” promotion ceremony for our 5th grade students on Thursday, May 28, 2020 at the KES bus loop from 5:00-6:00PM.
With no more than ONE CAR PER STUDENT, you may enter the bus loop and pull around to your child’s homeroom teacher (they will be spaced around the loop). Each teacher will hand any belongings of the student and any certificates earned this year to the student as you pull up.
Although this is not the ceremony our students deserve, we wanted to send them off to middle school with a chance to say “good bye”.
Our staff will be practicing social distancing and ask that our guests do the same. You are asked to stay in your car at all times. Please be respectful and patient, as we do plan for many cars to attend our drive-thru. Please reach out to your child’s teacher with any questions!

post_text:
CHS JUNIORS AND SENIORS--ORDER YOUR "ALMOST" AFTER PROM T SHIRT NOW! Since the Prom/After Prom did not occur, the After Prom Committee decided to print After Prom Shirts for you to have to commemorate this unusual school year!

If you would like one, email janet.johnson@k12lcps.org with your name and shirt size. DEADLINE TO ORDER IS TUESDAY, MAY 26, 2020.

Shirts will be here by June 5. You will be notified as to how you will get the shirt.

SHIRT DETAILS:
SHORT SLEEVE BLACK SHIRT WITH WHITE LETTERING.

DESIGN WILL BE ON THE FRONT OF THE SHIRT.

ADULT SIZES - Small, Medium, Large, X Large, 2X-Large, 3X-Large, 4X-Large, 5X-Large

T SHIRTS ARE FREE!!!!!!!

post_text:
With the current situation with the COVID-19 Pandemic, senior celebrations and graduation will definitely be different. We love our CHS Seniors, and we are getting excited about all of the plans we have for them. Here is a list of our activities for the Class of 2020:

*May 17 at 11 AM - Drive Up Baccalaureate at the Girls' Softball/Lightning Football field in Kenbridge
*May 26 from 3-6 PM - Drive Thru Cap & Gown Orders (for those who still need cap and gown) at CHS - Please bring cash in exact change. Cap & Gown is $55. Announcements are $2. Tassels are $10. Caps are $15.
*May 27 at 7 PM - Drive Thru Curbside Senior Celebration
*May 28 at 6 PM - Virtual Class Night
*May 30 at 9 AM - Drive Up Graduation - 2 vehicles per student at CHS

Dr. Stanislas will be sending a letter home with more details about procedures. Congratulations Class of 2020!

The Governor's School of Southside Virginia
May 6 at 6:17 PM ·

Our amazing teachers spent their day delivering graduation signs to the seniors of all 11 schools. While some students weren't home, we hope they enjoyed their surprise waiting for them in their yard when they returned.

We have missed you all the past 8 weeks and are proud of how hard you worked to make the most of this situation. We have no doubt you will continue to do great things!

If your senior is not pictured here with his/her sign, please message GSSV Facebook page or email the pictures to wesley.swain@southside.edu.

shared_text:
Kenbridge Elementary School
May 6 at 9:27 AM ·

Shoutout to Ms. Jackson from two KES parents:
“Ms Jackson has called me to check on my son. She made sure he received his learning packet. Ms Jackson offered to assist in any way to further his learning. I’m glad she made herself available to help him with questions or anything else we may need as a family.”
“Since the closing Mrs. Jackson has reached out to us checking on my son several times. It’s obvious her heart is a hundred percent into what she does . The amount of care she has shown is amazing. Having her support during this unpredictable time has been amazing. She is always willing to help and has made it clear if we need anything she will help. Truly a blessing to have her as my son’s teacher.”

Do you know a staff member that is making a difference for our students, families, and community during this time of our school closure? Fill out this form if you would like to share:
https://forms.gle/nmb94YvSYz4x1RuW9

The first "event" of graduation week is Baccalaureate service. For the last few years, this service has been sponsored by Kenbridge Christian Church and this year is no different. Please come out Sunday morning May 17th at 11 a.m. for this service in which one of your own classmates, Caleb Bailey, will be speaking to the Class of 2020. The service will be held at the girls' softball field in Kenbridge as a drive-in service. Look forward to seeing each of you there!

Kenbridge Elementary School
May 2 at 12:12 PM ·

Have you ordered your yearbook? This is definitely a year to remember! No fear you can order your KES yearbook at www.yearbookordercenter.com and searching for the school name, or entering the school code 11659. For ordering help, call The Yearbook Order Center toll free at 866-287-3096 or email them at yearbookordercenter@herffjones.com.

You can also purchase a yearbook and pay by eCheck through the toll-free number. The Yearbook Order Center is open Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (CST) - this time may adjust based on COVID-19.

post_text: The Lunenburg County School Board will meet on Monday, May 11, 2020. The meeting will be held at the Lunenburg Middle School Library 7:30 p.m. We will adhere to the ten person regulation for this meeting. Any person wishing to participate during public participation will need to contact Superintendent Charles Berkley on or before May 8, 2020.

shared_text:
Kenbridge Elementary School
April 24 at 4:05 PM ·

Shoutout to Ms. Braxter from a KES parent:
"Ms. Braxter has been very supportive before school was released and after with my son. She has built a very good relationship with my family and is always checking in making sure we are okay. She is an amazing teacher and I hate that school was cut short so my son couldn’t end the year with her. I feel any student that comes in contact with her will be very happy to have her as a teacher. I will end with one word that describes Ms. Braxter and that is “sunshine” because whenever she is around she will brighten your day."

Do you know a staff member that is making a difference for our students, families, and community during this time of our school closure? Fill out this form if you would like to share:
https://forms.gle/nmb94YvSYz4x1RuW9

post_text:
Senior Parents - There is Still Time to Place a Senior Tribute Ad in the CHS Yearbook! If anyone has not already gotten a senior ad in the yearbook for this year and still would like to do so, we have additional space for these senior tributes. All we need are any pictures you would like to use or if you want to use their senior pictures we have those, and what you would like the ad to say. We can design the ads or if you have a specific way you want it to look, you may also send that. Above is a picture of some past senior ads. It has 1/2 page and 1/4 page ads on them. With the loss of some of the events this year we will have additional space for extra tribute ads.

Ad prices are:
1/4 page is $25
1/2 page is $40
full page is $75

If you would like an ad, you can mail in a check to the Central High School office at 131 KV Road Victoria Va, 23974, and make the check to CHS Yearbook. You may also email Brian Nowlin with any other questions you may have at brian.nowlin@k12lcps.org

Please try to have any ads in by May 4!

post_text: Good evening LCPS Families! Please keep checking our website and the division and school Facebook pages for up to date information from the school system. Also, please download our app and enable push notifications as well. Our Learning Portal can be accessed on our website. Please check it regularly. And please make sure that students who have school email are checking it and their google classrooms. Let's work together to keep our students learning!
text: Good evening LCPS Families! Please keep checking our website and the division and school Facebook pages for up to date information from the school system. Also, please download our app and enable push notifications as well. Our Learning Portal can be accessed on our website. Please check it regularly. And please make sure that students who have school email are checking it and their google classrooms. Let's work together to keep our students learning!

shared_text:
Central High School
April 17 at 3:05 PM ·

CHS Students please continue to send in pictures for our yearbook. We have gotten in some great pictures and want as many of you as possible to send in even more. We are creating pages with pictures and thoughts from students during their time at home, pages with students dressed up that includes any prom clothes and we are doing a cap and gown pictures page for seniors that can send in one.
In addition to that we have gotten inquiries from people still wanting to order yearbooks. We will have additional copies available so please email me if you would like to reserve one. Starting next week, any parents that would like to put in a senior tribute ad and have not done so will be able to do that as well. Look for an email and additional information early next week. All pictures and information or questions can be sent to brian.nowlin@k12lcps.org.

April 15 at 8:35 AM ·

LMS Yearbook purchases are available online through Jostens Memorybook.

Follow this link: https://www.memorybook.com/online-pay/parent-pay/
Enter school code : 123733
Click link below school name
You may have to register as a new user

Once that step is completed, follow the instructions for ordering
Online orders can be placed through April 26.

If you have not ordered a book, or are unable to order online, there will be books available for purchase when they are in for distribution. However, there will be a limited number of extra books available.

Math is EVERYWHERE! Shelby has been using math to put up fencing today! Math + the outdoors + hard work!! I would consider this a very successful home learning experience!!

If you need to submit an application, please bring it to the School Board Office, and use the dropbox slot in the left garage door at the bus shop. Thank you.

post_text: Hayley Moody, a junior at Central High School, won first place in the high school division of the Virginia School Board Association’s (VSBA) Southern Regional Art Contest. Winners were chosen from an impressive selection of art from around the region. Hayley is the daughter of Bryan and Valerie Moody. She is a student at the Governor’s School of Southside Virginia as well. She is also a member of the National Honor Society, CHS Cares/Kindness Matters and the CHS Volleyball Team. Congratulations on this outstanding honor, Hayley!

Central High School
March 31 at 2:02 PM ·

Parents: If your student was in Economics and Personal Finance class this year, they participated in a 10-week simulation called the Budget Challenge. Ask them about this very realistic experience! They made choices about their apartment, auto and renter's insurance, 401-K contributions, and much more.

Some classes finished the week we got out of school, but others did not Have they been paying their bills while these past few weeks? There is a separate link to a parent survey for each teacher's group below as well as on the LCPS Learning Portal.

Mrs. McGrath's Classes - https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/JRFBBW2

Mrs. Scott's Classes - https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/XWCHGXG

Mrs. Watson's Classes - https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/LKX7M9X

post_text:
Reminders and Updates for LCPS Families:
*LCPS COVID-19 Wifi is available by driving to one of our 4 school buildings. Instructions on how to use it can be found on our website www.lunenburgcountyschools.org
*FREE MEALS are every Monday and Thursday from 11 am-1 pm at Kenbridge Elementary School and Central High School EXCEPT THE WEEK OF APRIL 13-17!
*Keep working on learning packets and accessing the LCPS Learning Portal on our website for school work and activities.
*There will be no SOL Tests this year.
We will update you with information as it becomes available.
*Please stay at home, stay safe, and stay healthy!

shared_text:
Central Chargers Baseball
March 31 at 11:52 AM ·

To start the highlight of the 2020 Chargers Baseball players it seems fitting to begin with our lead-off man.
BEN ANTHONY
Ben Anthony is a senior captain that has been a 3 year starter on the varsity team. Ben has been a stand-out middle infielder having played 2B as a sophomore and then moving to SS the past two seasons. His play on the field has given him individual honors such as All-District and All-Region while helping the team reach the playoffs. As our lead-off hitter he set the table for others and did whatever was needed to help the team win.
Ben is a a talented player on the baseball field because of his athleticism and great attitude. I can't say enough good things about his attitude and him as person. He is truly a leader by example and someone that his team can count on to always do things the right way and to give his best. Ben is a great representative of the team, of Central High School and of Charger Pride! Benjamin Anthony Michael Anthony Wanda Elliott Anthony Kayla Anthony Sandy L. Noblin-Anthony
Picture from ShutterBatte Photography

All incomplete work needs to be turned in by Wednesday, April 1st. These assignments were due BEFORE we were released from school. post_text: PRE K APPLICATIONS ARE DUE NOW!! ALL, and we emphasize ALL, four years olds in Lunenburg County are encouraged to apply! If there are enough applicants and funding is available, we may offer two classes of Pre K at Victoria Elementary School. Applications can be dropped off in the drop box slot in the garage door to the left of the bus shop at the school board office. We look forward to receiving your application!

shared_text:
Lunenburg Middle School
March 23 at 7:03 PM ·

Dear Students,

We have mailed each of you a packet with your report card, your schedule request form for next year, and work to keep your mind fresh.

We know you have concerns about items you have left in the school and we are working on a plan for you to be able to get those things. More details will be given in the coming days.

While school is out, we encourage you to read for pleasure or knowledge, get lots of fresh air and exercise, learn how to do some things around the house, and follow guidelines to avoid catching or spreading germs.

Take care of yourselves and know that you are missed by all of us at LMS.

post_text:
Lunenburg County Public Schools will close for the remainder of the school year (2019-2020) due to the COVID-19 pandemic as directed by Governor Northam. We ask for your understanding and patience during this challenging time. We all have many questions, and we will be getting guidance from the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) moving forward. At the present time:

*All events and activities are canceled until further notice.
*Learning packets were mailed today. Please use these packets to work with your child.
*We are making modifications to our online learning portal based on guidelines that we are being given from the VDOE, and we will release it as soon as possible.
*Keep checking the app, the website, and the facebook pages for updated information.
text:
Lunenburg County Public Schools will close for the remainder of the school year (2019-2020) due to the COVID-19 pandemic as directed by Governor Northam. We ask for your understanding and patience during this challenging time. We all have many questions, and we will be getting guidance from the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) moving forward. At the present time:

*All events and activities are canceled until further notice.
*Learning packets were mailed today. Please use these packets to work with your child.
*We are making modifications to our online learning portal based on guidelines that we are being given from the VDOE, and we will release it as soon as possible.
*Keep checking the app, the website, and the facebook pages for updated information.

shared_text:
Victoria Elementary School
February 27 at 7:05 PM ·

For February, VES faculty & staff have been participating in “Kindness Month” to promote a culture of love & being kind. Today, we all wore black to school & were treated to bright paper flowers (made by some of our 5th grade students) to wear that represented a “bright spot” in each of our days during school. All day long, teachers & staff were able to share their “bright spots” with Mrs. Dalton & Mrs. Peebles.

Students have had such a good time this month participating in our morning trivia games, “Guess the...” games, & witnessing acts of kindness among adults. We are proud to have people at our school that strive to be positive, kind role models for our students!

Victoria Elementary School
February 12 at 8:24 PM ·

This month, we are hosting a bus challenge for students to promote bus safety and positive behavior. Each day, bus drivers are rating their routes on a chart. The bus with highest score at the end of the week wins a treat! Additionally, drivers are giving out “Golden Bus” tickets to students with excellent behavior. We collect the tickets and draw names at the beginning of the week. Here are our first 2 winners! We are so proud 😊
text:
Victoria Elementary School
February 12 at 8:24 PM ·

This month, we are hosting a bus challenge for students to promote bus safety and positive behavior. Each day, bus drivers are rating their routes on a chart. The bus with highest score at the end of the week wins a treat! Additionally, drivers are giving out “Golden Bus” tickets to students with excellent behavior. We collect the tickets and draw names at the beginning of the week. Here are our first 2 winners! We are so proud 😊

post_text: 2020-2021 Pre K Applications are NOW available! Our Pre K Screening Day will be on April 10, 2020 at Kenbridge Elementary School. Get your application in by March 13, 2020 to receive an appointment time! You can get a hard copy of the application at either Victoria or Kenbridge Elementary or at the school board office. The application is also on our website at www.lunenburgcountyschools.org. Go to the menu on the main page, and you will find the application under the "Parents" section.

post_text:
Flu season is here! Listed below are some helpful guidelines to know when to keep your child at home. It is important that you BE at school when you are NOT sick, but we also need help to keep school as germ-free as possible!

Attendance reminders: Please send a note from a doctor or a parent note within 3 days of your child’s return to school. Doctor's notes are always accepted. Parent notes can only be accepted for 6 total absences per school year.
text:
Flu season is here! Listed below are some helpful guidelines to know when to keep your child at home. It is important that you BE at school when you are NOT sick, but we also need help to keep school as germ-free as possible!

Attendance reminders: Please send a note from a doctor or a parent note within 3 days of your child’s return to school. Doctor's notes are always accepted. Parent notes can only be accepted for 6 total absences per school year.

shared_text:
Victoria Elementary School
December 13, 2019 at 8:34 PM ·

One of our 5th graders has been OBSESSED with the book series, “The Black Lagoon”. There are 60 books in the series and she’s read 57 of them since September!! Mrs. Lawson, one of her teachers, was desperate to help her finish reading the series, but was unable to find the books after searching local libraries, thrift stores, & countless websites. Mrs. Lawson found the author’s website and emailed the address listed. The famous author himself, Mike Thaler, replied!! Additionally, he mailed Mrs. Lawson AND Brooklynn personalized letters, a poster, signed copies of his books, and a signed copy of an unpublished book of his.

To say we are proud of both Brooklynn AND her reading teachers, Mrs. Lawson & Miss Newcomb, for encouraging and supporting her love of reading is an understatement! 🥰

shared_text:
Central High School
December 11, 2019 at 10:56 AM ·

THE CHARGER PRIDE OUTLET IS OPEN FOR BUSINESS!
Marketing Students at CHS created a school store which opened today before school. This school store is available to students in the mornings before school begins, during lunches on select days and at select home basketball games. A set schedule will be posted soon.

The store includes not only school supplies, but Charger Spirit items. This is a class project which gives the marketing students experience in customer service, pricing, inventory, and sales promotions.

Items will continue to be added to the cart throughout the year.

post_text: LCPS honored the service of our retiring school board members, Elizabeth Williams and Ada Whitehead. We welcome new board members Melanie Currin and Ruby Ingram, who were sworn in by Clerk of the Court Gordon Erby along with Kathy Coffee and Doug Aubel who are returning for another term. They will start their terms January 1, 2020.

Central High School
November 11, 2019 at 12:16 PM ·

Summer W. is our November Employee of the Month! She is works at Subway and has many responsibilities. Summer's supervisor says she is responsible and always does a great job! She has excellent customer service. Summer plans to pursue a career in the airline industry by completing a certification in flight training after she graduates from CHS in the Spring. She plans to earn degrees in Aviation Management, Flight Operations, Public Relations and foreign language in order to eventually work for Delta International.

post_text: Kenbridge and Victoria Elementary Families came out last night for Learning Under the Stars at the Victoria Railroad Park. Over 260 attended and families were able to enjoy snacks, participate in fun learning activities, get free books, and much more. Thank you to Victoria Fire & Rescue, Lunenburg Sheriff’s Department, Victoria Police Department, Virginia Cooperative Extension, Corp. of Engineers/Kerr Dam, Department of Forestry, LMS FFA, and all the LCPS staff who helped make it such a fun event!

post_text: October is National Farm to School Month. And this week, October 7-11, is Virginia Farm to School Week. In celebration, each of our schools today participated in “The Crunch Heard ‘Round the Commonwealth.” Our students “crunched” on delicious, fresh apples! #FarmtoSchool #VACrunch

post_text:
October is Farm to School Month and we want to highlight the partnership between CHS Agriculture students and the cafeteria. Students in Ms. Hood's Agriculture classes are growing cucumbers, lettuce, herbs, and arugula and once the produce is harvested, they take the produce to the cafeteria. Students from the Plants Systems class are pictured here with our cafeteria manager.

Check this link out to find out more about October as Farm to School Month
http://www.farmtoschool.org/our-work/farm-to-school-month

post_text: LCPS Students: LCPS Attendance Poster Contest has been extended until Friday, October 4 by 3 pm. Poster should be on 8.5 x 11 paper and reference our theme “Get Schooled.” Poster should portray why it is cool to be at school everyday. First prize for each school is a Fire 7 Tablet with Alexa. Turn your poster into school by the end of the day on Friday!
text: LCPS Students: LCPS Attendance Poster Contest has been extended until Friday, October 4 by 3 pm. Poster should be on 8.5 x 11 paper and reference our theme “Get Schooled.” Poster should portray why it is cool to be at school everyday. First prize for each school is a Fire 7 Tablet with Alexa. Turn your poster into school by the end of the day on Friday!

post_text: LCPS Students: Attendance Video Contest deadline has be extended to October 9, 2019 at 3 p.m. Just a reminder that videos should focus on the theme "Get Schooled" and portray why it is cool to come to school. It can be a commercial, a rap, a poem. It should be short, catchy, and to the point. Please email your video to shakeyau.jackson@k12lcps.org. Prize is $300 cash donated by Benchmark Community Bank and Alpha Beta Psi Sorority at Longwood University.

Mrs. K. Hall’s class used Scholastic Book flyers to sort titles onto chart paper by the author’s purpose.

Mrs. Pinchefsky’s class started a project to see if beans will grow in a bag using different variables.

Their smiles are contagious 🤗

Virginia Department of Education - VDOE
September 12, 2019 at 11:30 AM ·

Central High School staff shared their #Back2SchoolVA2019 experience with us recently:

The school floors are glistening and the bulletin boards promote inclusion and being kind in our school. The faculty and staff were treated to dinner for our Open House and school supplies were donated by a local industry, ABC Recycling. Students entered the building--full of smiles and happy to return. Finally---as you can see, we are located within the rainbow and our school is full of endless pride and opportunities.

Lunenburg County Public Schools

Central High School staff shared their #Back2SchoolVA2019 experience with us recently:

The school floors are glistening and the bulletin boards promote inclusion and being kind in our school. The faculty and staff were treated to dinner for our Open House and school supplies were donated by a local industry, ABC Recycling. Students entered the building--full of smiles and happy to return. Finally---as you can see, we are located within the rainbow and our school is full of endless pride and opportunities.

Lunenburg County Public Schools

shared_text:
Central High School
May 29, 2019 at 12:08 PM ·

Congratulations to Kayla C. and Sierra E. for earning their Microsoft Office 2016 Specialist certifications in Excel, PowerPoint, and Word! Sierra also earned her Microsoft Word Expert certification. Students have the opportunity to earn Microsoft certifications in Digital Applications and Computer Information Systems. Individuals with Microsoft Specialist certifications have a professional and scholastic edge when they obtain these globally recognized industry endorsed evidence of skills mastery. The certifications demonstrate their abilities and willingness to embrace new technologies. Congratulations Kayla and Sierra for your accomplishments!

shared_text:
Lunenburg Middle School
May 26, 2019 at 10:30 PM ·

8th Grade Graduation is Tuesday evening, May 28 at 6:00! A few reminders are as follows:

1. All eighth-grade students who are graduating need to be in the LMS cafeteria by 5:30 on Tuesday evening.

2. All students need to be dressed appropriately, meaning they need to be wearing the following: dresses/skirts that are fingertip-length or longer, blouses/dressy shirts, slacks/khakis/dress pants, collared shirts, dress/dressy shoes. Students not dressed appropriately will NOT be permitted to walk!

This is a very exciting event, and we are all looking forward to it! If you are a family member or friend of an eighth grader, we hope you’re able to attend and celebrate these students with us!

post_text:
J. and T. McDaniel work for IMG College Seating. We thought it would be fitting to share this picture of them working for this company at 8-years-old. They know the college football/seat cushion business very well and have traveled from Maryland to South Carolina helping out over the years. They plan on being lineman after graduation this year.

The McDaniel brothers will continue to work for IMG College Seating this summer until they start lineman school.

post_text: LCPS appreciates our amazing teachers! If you see a teacher this week, tell them, "Thank You!" May 6-10 is Teacher Appreciation Week. Teachers work hard on a daily basis, going above and beyond, to educate our students. They mold young lives and give them the tools they need to become productive citizens. The impact our teachers have on our community is immeasurable! Thank you for all you do!

shared_text:
Kenbridge Elementary School
April 9, 2019 at 2:38 PM ·

A huge shout out to someone very special to our KES family: Ms. Matthews plays many roles and wears many hats at KES. She spends her time teaching students to read, crunching academic data, making motivating visuals for our accelerated reader program, motivating staff, bringing joy and laughter to the building, and helping everything to continue running in the right direction. Ms. Matthews gives her all to the students and staff at KES. This year she has been both the Reading Specialist for K-2 and the Assistant Principal. The elementary schools in Lunenburg have not had full-time assistant principals in many years. Last night, Mr. Berkley and the school board announced that Ms. Matthews will be the full-time Assistant Principal of KES for the 2019-2020 school year! Congratulations Ms. Matthews! This news came just in time for Assistant Principal appreciation week! Ms. Matthews, we appreciate all of the love and work you put in for our school!

post_text: At last night's School Board Meeting three students were recognized for their artwork that was selected for the VSBA Regional Spring Network Forums Art Contest. These students were D. Mosher from Kenbridge Elementary (pictured here with Mr. Berkley and Mrs. Coffee), T. Simpson from Lunenburg Middle (artwork pictured here), and K. Snead from Central High School (artwork pictured here). K. Snead won third place overall in the contest! Congratulations to these hardworking art students!

post_text: Congratulations to our classes that won the Perfect Attendance Car Race! We have Krista Hall's Class at VES, Victoria Parrott's Class at KES, and Brenda Wade's Class at LMS. The entire class was awarded a t-shirt. Teachers were given a gift certificate donated by Shear Designs and a set of Sharpie art markers donated by Kenbridge Office & School Supply! Great job with attendance guys! Keep up the good work. And thank you to our community partners for making a donation to the cause! #LCPSAttendanceChallenge

post_text:
CHS April Co-op Students of the Month--

D. Bishop works for Bishop Construction. He plans to attend lineman school in the fall. He enjoys working for his family’s business each day. He loves the freedom of being able to attend school and work.

D. Morris works for the Town of Victoria. His supervisor says he is a great worker, always works hard and does anything asked of him. He plans to continue working for the town when he graduates.

B. Franklin works for Kenbridge Industrial Electrical Services. He plans to attend lineman school in the fall. Working with this local business helps him learn more about electrical which will help him in his future full time career.

post_text:
LCPS March Madness Attendance Challenge Championship Round

The voting prediction for the final four:
VES V.S. KES
Moody/Hershberger/Pinchefsky (52%) v.s. Nowlin/Wilkins/Bentley (48%)

LMS V.S. CHS
M.Ellis/Bailey (40%) v.s. Davis/Cundiff/R.McGrath (60%)

After four weeks non-stop we have made it to the final showdown. In the final four KES (97%) classes pulled out a win over VES (95%). Mrs. Bentley's class at KES maintained perfect attendance all week last week.

In the matchup between CHS and LMS, LMS (96%) classes were able to pull out a win over CHS (90%). In this week's matchup between LMS and KES, we will have a winner for our 2019 March Madness-inspired attendance contest.

Great job to all our classes for participation in this challenge!

Don't forget to place your votes:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdjVJl7YmaKRU5srrt-cCd5iFO-xc6HuGVofjcED0juQ0peKw/viewform

post_text:
Attention Seniors!

You will be taking your Cap & Gown pictures on this coming, MONDAY----APRIL 1ST!

Strawbridge will be taking individual shots of the 2019 senior class! This will begin around 11:30 am.

Students can bring their own cap and gown to wear or Strawbridge does have caps and gowns that can be worn for the individual pictures. Strawbridge can also provide shirts and ties for the guys who need them. Students that will use the Strawbridge caps and gowns just need to wear a t-shirt.

A Group Picture will take place at a later date. NOT on Monday.

post_text: We're down to the Final Four for our March Madness Attendance Challenge! The teams have been competing the last four weeks and four teams have made it to the final four round representing their schools in the Final Four face off. Representing from VES is Mrs. Moody (K), Mrs. Hershberger (5th grade), and Mrs. Pinchesky (4th grade); from KES, are Mrs. Nowlin (K), Mrs. Wilkins (3rd Grade), and Mrs. Bentley (5th Grade). The 1st period classroom teams representing LMS are Mr. Bailey and Mr. Ellis, and at CHS the 1st-period classroom teams are Mrs. Davis, Mrs. Cundiff, and Mr. McGrath. VES and KES will face off in the Finale Four attendance round while LMS and CHS will face off. Your teams are all pictured here! #LCPSAttendanceChallenge

post_text:
The Lunenburg County Historical Society is pleased to announce the winners of its 2018-2019 essay contest among 8th grade students who attend Lunenburg Middle School or who live in Lunenburg County and are either home-schooled or attend a private school outside of the county. This year’s winners are
First Place: K. Moore
Second Place: J. Foltz
Third Place: P. Mojica-Manuel
Honorable Mention: N. Webster
Each winner received a certificate and a monetary prize.
Photo: (Left to right) First Place: K. Moore; Third Place: P. Mojica-Manuel; Honorable Mention: N. Webster; Mrs. Brenda Wade, coordinator of the contest for the historical society. Not pictured: Second Place winner J. Foltz.

post_text: If your child will be 4 years old on or before September 30, 2019--it's time to get your application in for the LCPS Pre K Program. Deadline for applications to be received is next Friday, March 15, 2019 in order to be assigned an appointment time for the Pre K Screening Day on April 8, 2019. You can pick up a hard copy of the application at the school board office, Kenbridge Elementary, and Victoria Elementary. You can also find a copy of the application on our website. www.lunenburgcountyschools.org
